text: The Borowitz Report: Donald Trump said that, when his election lawsuits are argued in court, his special expertise will win the day. “For my entire life, I have been drenched in fraud,” he said. https://t.co/2jXVE2YJZ9

text: Even as Joe Biden is poised to expel Donald Trump from the White House, extinguishing one crisis facing the country, Congress remains up for grabs. https://t.co/mP9SFAPSeX

text: The slow drip of election results from Nevada, Pennsylvania, and the other states that have yet to be called emphasizes how surprisingly steady and unbothered the past few days have been. https://t.co/7ZjvRahfrl

text: “We’re seeing him do exactly what we said he’d do—try to steal the election through voter suppression,” a lawyer protesting President Trump’s attempts to undermine the election said. “It needs to be every city and every town marching.” https://t.co/3153rkP9ey

text: “The Chinese lockdown was more intense than almost anywhere else in the world,” writes Peter Hessler, who teaches at Sichuan University. It wasn’t unheard-of for a door to be sealed shut during contact-tracing if a family was suspected of exposure. https://t.co/y05lodvVt7
